description:
test_models_sync() is currently making assumptions, that won't be true in the upcoming Alembic releases (0.7.7 and 0.8.0 respectively). Unless we fix it now, it's going to break the gate when the releases of Alembic are cut.

Mike Bayer's comment in the original patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192760/14/nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py,cm

ML thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/071638.html
title: test_models_sync() will be broken on upcoming Alembic versions

comments.content:
test_models_sync() is currently making assumptions, that won't be true in the upcoming Alembic releases (0.7.7 and 0.8.0 respectively). Unless we fix it now, it's going to break the gate when the releases of Alembic are cut.

Mike Bayer's comment in the original patch:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192760/14/nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py,cm

ML thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/071638.html

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/211218
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: oh those assumptions aren't true in *any* alembic version, this format hasn't changed.    The failures I had in nova were due to an actual behavioral change that occurred in the unreleased 0.8 which I've since fixed.   I think we normally don't see failures here because we're only filtering diffs in a context where diffs are generally not expected anyway, so we get a pretty slim number of them.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~zzzeek

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/211218
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=0a1eab6c945afa81f7526a3b5964d42788684298
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 0a1eab6c945afa81f7526a3b5964d42788684298
Author: Roman Podoliaka <email address hidden>
Date:   Mon Aug 10 17:34:56 2015 +0300

    Ensure test_models_sync() works with new Alembic releases
    
    test_models_sync() test is currently making assuptions about Alembic,
    which might not be true in the upcoming releases: e.g. Column object
    will not necessarily be bound to a Table instance.
    
    Fix this by using the format described at:
    
    http://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/rel_0_7/api.html#alembic.autogenerate.compare_metadata
    
    Also, the code has been refactored a bit, so that we don't have to go
    over a list of differences multiple times and it's not changed in-place
    anymore (removing elements from the list while iterating over it is
    error-prone on its own).
    
    Closes-Bug: #1483287
    
    Change-Id: Id0b8a9b7b11ee2cd249176cab403befdd9e06dbd
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
